resources.string:
"Quick Guide:

Step 1 – Enable ADB Debugging
In order for the Fire TV to accept sideloaded apps, you must enable ADB Debugging. You may turn it back off once you’re done sideloading apps.
From the home screen, scroll down to “Settings”
Scroll right to “SYSTEM”
Scroll down to “Developer Options”
Change “ADB debugging” to “ON”
Change ”Unknown Sources” to ”ON”

Step 2 – Obtain your Fire TV’s IP Address
From the home screen, scroll down to “Settings”
Scroll right to “SYSTEM”
Select “About”
Scroll down to “Network”
Write down the numbers next to “IP Address”

You find installed apps on Fire TV / Fire Stick at Settings > Applications > Manage Installed Applications.

Beta Version with a known bug: if you write wrong ip adress (xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx, no spaces, input with “.”) app will hang, also sometimes after transfering all apps too. if all apps installed on your firetv you may safely force-close the app from your phone's settings menu. will be fixed in next releases.
 Last but not least: thanks for trying/using our app. We are happy for emails and market comments. Thank you!"
Hi,\nis this App usefull? Then it would be amazing if you could write a comment on Google Play. Wanna open Google Play Entry?

Howto: Start your Fire TV and use same network/Wifi with this device
1.) Input FireTV IP Address in Settings. 
2.) Select Apps from List below 
3.) Press "->FireTV" Button 
4.) Wait (minimize with home button)
Select the apps you want to push!
Donate (still shows ads in this version) or buy DonateVersion at Google Play to disable Ads.
Thank you for buying the donate Version!
Developersettings. Support us with fixing bugs and making this app better..
IP v4 Address, separate each number (0-254) with dots. Example: 192.168.0.1 oder 192.168.001.003
